sen.j: 満天姫（まてひめ、天正17年（1589年）？ - 寛永15年3月22日 (旧暦)（1638年5月5日））は、安土桃山時代 - 江戸時代の女性で、徳川家康の異父弟・下総関宿藩主松平康元の娘。
sen.e: Matehime (1589 - May 5, 1638) was the woman during the Azuchi-Momoyama period to the Edo period and a daughter of Yasumoto MATSUDAIRA, the lord of Sekiyado domain in Simofusa Province, a half brother of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.

Matehime (1589 - May 5, 1638), a woman who lived from the Azuchi-Momoyama period to the Edo period, was a daughter of Yasumoto MATSUDAIRA, the lord of the Sekiyado domain in Simofusa Province a the half-brother of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.

Matehime (1589 - May 5, 1638), a woman who lived from the Azuchi-Momoyama period to the Edo period, was a daughter of the lord of the Sekiyado Domain in Shimosa Province, Yasumoto MATSUDAIRA who was the half-brother of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。Domain大文字にしました。

sen.j: 福島正之正室、子に大道寺直秀。
sen.e: She was Masayuki FUKUSHIMA's lawful wife, and Naohide DAIDOJI was their child.
She was Masayuki FUKUSHIMA's lawful wife, and Naohide DAIDOJI was their child.
She was a wife of Masayuki FUKUSHIMA and had a son Naohide DAIDOJI.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: のち津軽信枚正室、子に津軽信英。
sen.e: Later, she became Nobuhiro TSUGARU's lawful wife and Nobufusa TSUGARU was their child.
Later she became Nobuhiro TSUGARU's lawful wife, and Nobufusa TSUGARU was their child.
Later, she became the lawful wife of Nobuhiro TSUGARU and had a son Nobufusa TSUGARU.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 略伝
sen.e: Brief biography
Brief biography
Brief biography

sen.j: 最初の結婚と離婚
sen.e: First marriage and divorce
First marriage and divorce
First marriage and divorce

sen.j: 伯父・家康の養女となり、慶長4年（1599年）に福島正則の養嗣子・福島正之（正則の姉の夫・別所重宗の七男）に嫁ぐ。
sen.e: She was adopted by her uncle, Ieyasu TOKUNAGA, and married Masayuki FUKUSHIMA (the seventh son of Shigemune BESSHO, the husband of Masanori's sister), adopted heir of Masanori FUKUSHIMA in 1599.

She was adopted by her uncle, Ieyasu TOKUNAGA, and in 1599 she married Masayuki FUKUSHIMA (the seventh son of Shigemune BESSHO, the husband of Masanori's sister), the adopted heir of Masanori FUKUSHIMA.

She was adopted by her uncle Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and in 1599, she married Masayuki FUKUSHIMA (the seventh son of Shigemune BESSHO, the husband of Masanori's older sister), the adopted heir of Masanori FUKUSHIMA.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、慶長12年（1607年）、正之が乱行のため幽閉され死去するに至り、正則の判断もあって実家に帰った（その後、義理の兄弟である福島忠勝に嫁ぐ、ともされる）。
sen.e: However, Masayuki was in confinement due to his misconduct and died eventually in 1607, so she went back to her family home partly because of Masanori's consideration (one theory described she married Tadakatsu FUKUSHIMA, her brother-in-law afterward).

However, Masayuki was in confinement due to his misconduct and eventually died in 1607, so she returned to her family home partly because of Masanori's consideration (one theory asserts that she later married Tadakatsu FUKUSHIMA, her brother-in-law).

However, Masayuki was in confinement due to his misconduct and eventually died in 1607, so she returned to her parents' home partly because of Masanori's consideration (one theory asserts that she later married Tadakatsu FUKUSHIMA, her brother-in-law).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: しかしこのとき満天姫は正之の子を身ごもっており、程なく男児を出産する。
sen.e: However, Matehime was pregnant by Masayuki on this occasion and soon gave birth to a baby boy.
However, Matehime was pregnant by Masayuki on this occasion and soon gave birth to a baby boy.
However, Matehime was pregnant by Masayuki at this time and soon gave birth to a baby boy.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 再婚と子供達
sen.e: Remarriage and her children
Remarriage and her children
Remarriage and children
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 慶長18年（1613年）、南光坊天海の進言もあり、家康は満天姫を津軽地方弘前藩主・津軽信枚に再嫁させることにした。
sen.e: In 1613, with Nankobo Tenkai's advice, Ieyasu have Matehime remarried Nobuhiro TSUGARU, the lord of Hirosaki domain in Tsugaru region.
In 1613, with Nankobo Tenkai's advice, Ieyasu instructed Matehime to remarry Nobuhiro TSUGARU, the lord of the Hirosaki domain in the Tsugaru region.
In 1613, with Nankobo Tenkai's advice, Ieyasu had Matehime remarry Nobuhiro TSUGARU, the lord of the Hirosaki Domain in the Tsugaru region.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。Domain大文字にしました。

sen.j: だが信枚にはすでに妻がいた。
sen.e: However, Nobuhiro already had a wife.
However, Nobuhiro already had a wife.
However, Nobuhiro already had a wife.

sen.j: 石田三成の三女・辰姫である。
sen.e: His wife was Tatsuhime, the third daughter of Mitsunari ISHIDA.
His wife was Tatsuhime, the third daughter of Mitsunari ISHIDA.
His wife was Tatsuhime, the third daughter of Mitsunari ISHIDA.

sen.j: 信枚の兄・津軽信建が小姓仲間であった石田重成と辰姫を関ヶ原の戦いの後に津軽に匿っていた縁からである。
sen.e: It was related to the fact that Nobutake TSUGARU, Nobuhiro's brother, sheltered Shigenari ISHIDA, who was his associate page, and Tatsuhime in Tsugaru after the Battle of Sekigahara.
This was related to the fact that Nobutake TSUGARU, Nobuhiro's brother, had sheltered Shigenari ISHIDA, his associate page, as well as Tatsuhime in Tsugaru after the Battle of Sekigahara.
This was related to the fact that Nobuhiro's brother Nobutake TSUGARU had sheltered his associate page Shigenari ISHIDA as well as Tatsuhime in Tsugaru after the Battle of Sekigahara.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 結局、辰姫は関ヶ原の戦いの論功として津軽家が得ていた飛び地領の上州大館村（現在の群馬県太田市（旧尾島町））に移されることとなり、満天姫は正室として迎えられた。
sen.e: Tatsuhime was eventually moved to Joshu Odate Village (present Ota City (former Ojima-cho), Gunma Prefecture), the outland where the Tsugaru family owned as the reward of the Battle of Sekigahara, and Matehime was received as the lawful wife.

Tatsuhime was eventually moved to Joshu Odate Village (the present-day Ota City, formerly Ojima-cho, Gunma Prefecture), the outland that the Tsugaru family had been given as a reward following the Battle of Sekigahara, and Matehime was received as the lawful wife.

Tatsuhime was eventually moved to Odate Village, Joshu Province (the present-day Ota City [formerly Ojima-cho], Gunma Prefecture), the outland that the Tsugaru family had been given as a reward for the Battle of Sekigahara, and Matehime was received as the lawful wife.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 正之との間にもうけた男児も一緒だった。
sen.e: She was with the son of Masayuki and her.
She was with the son of Masayuki.
She was with the son by Masayuki.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: だが信枚は辰姫のことが忘れ得ず、参勤交代の際には必ず大館村の辰姫の居館に立ち寄り、睦み合っていた。
sen.e: However, Nobuhiro could not get Tatsuhime out of his mind, so he visited Tatsuhime's residence in Odate Village at every Sankinkotai (a system under which feudal lords in the Edo period were required to spend every other year in residence in Edo) and became close to her.

However, Nobuhiro couldn't get Tatsuhime out of his mind, so he visited Tatsuhime's residence in Odate Village at every Sankinkotai (a system in which feudal lords in the Edo period were required to spend every other year in residence in Edo) and became close to her.

However, Nobuhiro couldn't get Tatsuhime out of his mind, so he visited Tatsuhime's residence in Odate Village at every Sankinkotai (a system in which feudal lords in the Edo period were required to spend every other year in residence in Edo) and became intimacy with her.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: その結果ついに辰姫は身ごもり、元和 (日本)5年（1619年）、男児を出産する。
sen.e: As a result, Tatsuhime became pregnant and gave birth to a baby boy in 1619.
As a result, Tatsuhime became pregnant and gave birth to a baby boy in 1619.
As a result, Tatsuhime became pregnant and gave birth to a baby boy in 1619.

sen.j: 男児は平蔵と名付けられた。
sen.e: The baby boy was named Heizo.
The child was given the name Heizo.
The child was named Heizo.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 信枚は平蔵を自分の跡取りにしたいと満天姫に懇願した。
sen.e: Nobuhiro begged Matehime to have Heizo be his heir.
Nobuhiro begged Matehime to have Heizo be his heir.
Nobuhiro begged Matehime to have Heizo his heir.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 一方満天姫も元和6年（1620年）、男児を出産する。
sen.e: On the other hand, Matehime also gave birth to a baby boy in 1620.
On the other hand, Matehime also gave birth to a baby boy in 1620.
On the other hand, also Matehime gave birth to a baby boy in 1620.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 辰姫は元和9年（1623年）に32歳で亡くなったため、上州大館村より平蔵は江戸藩邸に迎え入れられ、信枚の跡取りとして育てられた。
sen.e: Since Tatsuhime died at the age of thirty two, Heizo was brought into the residence of Edo domain from Joshu Odate Village and raised as Nobuhiro's heir.
Because Tatsuhime died 32 years of age, Heizo was brought into the residence of the Edo domain from Joshu Odate Village and raised as Nobuhiro's heir.
Because Tatsuhime died at the age of 32 in 1623, Heizo was brought into the residence of the Edo Domain from Joshu Odate Village and raised as Nobuhiro's heir.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。Domain大文字にしました。

sen.j: この平蔵は、後に信枚の後を次いで弘前藩第3代当主津軽信義となる。
sen.e: Heizo succeeded Nobuhiro later and became the third lord of Hirosaki domain, Nobuyoshi TSUGARU.
Heizo later succeeded Nobuhiro and became the third lord of the Hirosaki domain, Nobuyoshi TSUGARU.
Heizo later succeeded Nobuhiro and became the third lord of the Hirosaki Domain Nobuyoshi TSUGARU.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。Domain大文字にしました。

sen.j: 満天姫が福島正之との間にもうけた男児は、弘前藩の家老となっていた大道寺直英（後北条氏家臣大道寺政繁の養子）の養子に出され、大道寺直秀と名乗ることとなった。
sen.e: The son of Matehime and Masayuki FUKUSHIMA, was adopted by the chief retainer of Hirosaki domain, Naohide DAIDOJI (adopted child of Masashige DAIDOJI, the vassal of Gohojo clan), and used the name of Naohide DAIDOJI.

The son of Matehime and Masayuki FUKUSHIMA, was adopted by the chief retainer of the Hirosaki domain, Naohide DAIDOJI (the adopted child of Masashige DAIDOJI, a vassal of the Gohojo clan), and used the name Naohide DAIDOJI.

The son of Matehime and Masayuki FUKUSHIMA was adopted by the chief retainer of the Hirosaki Domain Naohide DAIDOJI (the adopted child of Masashige DAIDOJI, a vassal of the Gohojo clan) and assumed the name Naohide DAIDOJI.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。Domain大文字にしました。

sen.j: また、満天姫が信枚との間にもうけた男児は、信枚の二男として満天姫が育てた。
sen.e: Also, the son of Matehime and Nobuhiro, was raised by Matehime as the second son of Nobuhiro.
Also, the son of Matehime and Nobuhiro was raised by Matehime as the second son of Nobuhiro.
Also, the son of Matehime and Nobuhiro was raised by Matehime as the second son of Nobuhiro.

sen.j: この男児は、後に弘前藩の支藩・黒石藩の祖である津軽信英（のぶふさ）となる。
sen.e: This boy later became Nobufusa TSUGARU, the founder of Kuroishi domain, a branch domain of Hirosaki domain.
This boy later became Nobufusa TSUGARU, the founder of the Kuroishi domain, a branch of the Hirosaki domain.
This boy later became Nobufusa TSUGARU, who was the founder of the Kuroishi Domain, a branch of the Hirosaki Domain.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。Domain大文字にしました。

sen.j: 夫の死と「福島氏」再興運動の悲劇
sen.e: Her husband's death and tragedy of the campaign for the restoration of the 'Fukushima clan'
Her husband's death and the tragedy of the campaign to restore the 'Fukushima clan'
Her husband's death and the tragedy of unsuccessful restoration of the 'Fukushima clan'
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 寛永8年（1631年）、信枚が亡くなり、信義が3代藩主となった。
sen.e: In 1631, Nobuhiro died and Nobuyoshi became the third lord of the domain.
In 1631, Nobuhiro died and Nobuyoshi became the third lord of the domain.
In 1631, as Nobuhiro died, Nobuyoshi became the third lord of the domain.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 以後、満天姫は葉縦院と号するようになる。
sen.e: After that, Matehime called herself Yojuin.
sen.cmt: 「葉縦院」の正しい読み方を確認できませんでした。
sen.e: Subsequently, Matehime called herself Yojuin.
Since then, Matehime called herself Yojuin.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 一方、結局弘前藩の跡取りになれなかった大道寺直秀は、自らは福島正則の孫であるとして、このときすでに改易されていた。
sen.e: On the other hand, Naohide DAIDOJI, who could not become the heir of Hirosaki domain, had already been punished by being deprived of his fief at this time since he was a grandchild of Masanori FUKUSHIMA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On the other hand, Naohide DAIDOJI, who wasn't eligible to be the heir of the Hirosaki domain, had already been punished by being deprived of his fief, since he was a grandchild of Masanori FUKUSHIMA.

On the other hand, Naohide DAIDOJI, who wasn't eligible for the heir of the Hirosaki Domain but asserted himself as a grandchild of Masanori FUKUSHIMA, had already been punished by being deprived of his fief.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。Domain大文字にしました。

sen.j: 一旗本にまで身分を落としていた福島家の大名家再興を考えるようになり、しきりに活動するようになる。
sen.e: Naohide started to think about the restoration of the Fukushima family, whose class was lowered to hatamoto (a direct vassal of the shogun), and was eager to work on it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Naohide started to think about the restoration of the Fukushima family, whose class had been reduced to hatamoto (a direct vassal of the shogun), and was eager to work on it.
Naohide became anxious to restore the Fukushima family, which had been reduced to a direct vassal of the shogun, and started to work on it.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 葉縦院は、直秀の活動は幕府の心証を害し、津軽家に災いとなると考え、苦々しく思い、直秀を諫めていた。
sen.e: Yojuin thought Naohide's activities made a bad impression to the bakufu and brought harm to the Tsugaru family, so she embittered and remonstrated Naohide.
Yojuin thought Naohide's activities made a bad impression on the bakufu and brought harm to the Tsugaru family, so she became embittered and remonstrated Naohide.

As Yojuin feard Naohide's activities would make a bad impression on the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) which might bring harm to the Tsugaru family, she became embittered and remonstrated Naohide.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: だが直秀は一向に考えを改めることなく、ついに江戸へ上って江戸幕府に福島家再興を訴えると言い出した。
sen.e: However, Naohide did not change his mind and finally said that he was going up to Edo to appeal the restoration of the Fukushima family to Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

However, Naohide did not change his mind and finally said that he was going up to Edo in order to appeal the restoration of the Fukushima family to the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
However, Naohide did not change his mind, and finally said that he was going up to Edo in order to appeal the restoration of the Fukushima family to the Edo bakufu.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 寛永13年（1636年）、江戸に出発するため葉縦院の居所へあいさつにきた直秀は、葉縦院に進められるまま杯をあけると、急に苦しみだし、死んでしまう。
sen.e: In 1636, when Naohide visited the residence of Yojuin to say goodbye to leave for Edo, he emptied a sake cup as Yojuin suggested and started to struggle and died.
sen.cmt: 「葉縦院」の正しい読み方を確認できませんでした。
sen.e: In 1636, as Naohide visited the residence of Yojuin to say goodbye prior to his departure to Edo, he emptied a sake cup as Yojuin suggested, whereupon he started to struggle and died.
In 1636, as Naohide visited the residence of Yojuin to say goodbye prior to his departure to Edo, he emptied a cup of sake Yojuin suggested, whereupon he started to struggle and died.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 毒が盛られていたのである。
sen.e: It was poisoned.
The sake had been poisoned.
The sake had been poisoned.

sen.j: 寛永15年（1638年）、葉縦院（満天姫）は弘前で生涯を終えた。
sen.e: In 1638, Yojuin (Matehime) ended her life in Hirosaki.
sen.cmt: 「葉縦院」の正しい読み方を確認できませんでした。
sen.e: In 1638, Yojuin (Matehime) ended her life in Hirosaki.
In 1638, Yojuin (Matehime) died in Hirosaki.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 長勝寺 (弘前市)（青森県弘前市）に霊屋（国指定重要文化財）がある。
sen.e: Her tamaya (a mausoleum)(government-designated important cultural property) is at Chosho-ji Temple (Hirosaki City)(Hirosaki City, Aomori Prefecture).
Her tamaya (a mausoleum) (a government-designated important cultural property) is at Chosho-ji Temple, in Hirosaki City, Aomori Prefecture.
Her mausoleum (National Important Cultural Property) is at Chosho-ji Temple, in Hirosaki City, Aomori Prefecture.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 「関ヶ原合戦図屏風」
sen.e: Sekigahara Gassen-zu Byobu'
Sekigahara Gassen-zu Byobu'
Battle of Sekigahara folding screen'
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 津軽信枚との再婚の際、満天姫は、家康が描かせた「関ヶ原合戦図屏風」を泣いて懇願し、嫁入り道具として持参したという。
sen.e: When Matehime remarried Nobuhiro TSUGARU, she cried for the 'Sekigahara Gassen-zu Byobu' that Ieyasu had a painter draw and brought it as a bride's household article.
When Matehime remarried Nobuhiro TSUGARU, she cried for the 'Sekigahara Gassen-zu Byobu' that Ieyasu had a painter draw, and then brought it as a bride's household article.
When Matehime remarried Nobuhiro TSUGARU, she cried for the 'Battle of Sekigahara folding screen' that Ieyasu had a painter draw, and brought it as a bride's household article.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: この「関ヶ原合戦図屏風」は現在は国の重要文化財に指定されており、大阪歴史博物館が所蔵している。
sen.e: The 'Sekigahara Gassen-zu Byobu' is designated as a nationally important cultural property and held by Osaka Museum of History at present.
The 'Sekigahara Gassen-zu Byobu,' designated as a nationally important cultural property, is currently held by the Osaka Museum of History.
The 'Battle of Sekigahara folding screen' designated as a National Important Cultural Property is currently held in the Osaka Museum of History.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。
